page.title: 10ROYSTON PIT NATURE RESERVE
page.content: The Nature Reserve is on a steep hill with{chalk cliffs}and{disused lime {kilns.}A workman once fell down a hole at the back and was never seen again. The chalk was taken from the ground and burned for 3O hours at a high temperature,this made{lime}which farmers used to spread onto fields to grow better crops.It is very good on clay and acid soil and it is still used by farmers .Lime is also used in cement and mortar to build houses. We saw a robin as soon as we got in the Nature Reserve.These{birds}have been seen at the Nature Reserve:siskin brambling,greater spotted woodpecker, collared doves,bluetits,wren,dunnock, tree sparrow and gold finch.We saw a {hedgehog}on the way home.I saw two {squirrels.Muntjac deer}go into the Nature Reserve at night.{Plants}found here include herb bennet and hawthorn.
